intro: Pentameris praecox, commonly known as the early pentameris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is native to eastern North America and is often found in the understory of deciduous forests. Pentameris praecox is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes used in herbal medicine.
